election_record.label: Connecticut 1819 House of Representatives, New Haven, First Representative, Ballot 3

overview.note: "We have been thus particular in giving the state of the votes on each ballot because, means the most base and dishonorable have been resorted to be the federalist to cover their defeat, by creating an impression that the election of Mr. Ingersoll was an unfair one." Columbian Register (New Haven, CT). April 13, 1819.

"The sudden and mysterious acquisition of 39 Toleration votes, on the third round for first Representative, surprised every honest man - We can bring testimony that one man voted twice and was taken no notice of by the Board." The Connecticut Journal (New Haven, CT). April 6, 1819.
"[Charles Bostwick], though a republican, was put in nomination by the federalists, with a view of dividing our strength." Columbian Register (New Haven, CT). April 13, 1819.
